topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitor the Speed of Network Interface Card

body.p: The Icinga service, which runs in the undercloud, helps cloud admins monitor the speed of Network Interface Card (NIC) of the all the swift nodes.

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud

section.title: Monitoring the Speed of NIC
section.p: The Icinga monitors the minimum NIC speed requirement of the host. The performance of Swift cluster is dependent on the Ethernet speed and on the NIC of the machine. It is recommended to have a minimum NIC speed. If the host does not meet the required NIC speed then an error occurs.
Perform the following steps to monitor minimum NIC speed:

ol.li:
In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:
Username: icingaadmin
Password: icingaadmin

Click Status on the left panel and click Host Details.
The page navigates to the Host Status Details for all Hosts.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address> and displays the status of the NIC speed of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: WARNS- Network Interface check completed: Rx Over runs warning -15
CRIT - Network interface check completed: The network speed is 1000Mb/s and not matching.
Check for the network speed using ethtool.
